title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: Ellen Sanderson to O. O. Howard, October 12, 1868
summary: The original letter, from Ohio, inquires after a woman and her children living in Augusta County whose husband lives in Ohio. The letter asks about the possibilty of the family coming to Ohio to be reunited. The attached endorsements describe the situation of Catharine Crawford White, and the possibility of procuring Bureau support for her transport.
keywords: Administration/Bureaucracy, Aid/Relief, Employment/Labor, Family, Health/Illness, Local Government, Slavery, Women, American Civil War
